Package com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.detection

Class FileChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.detection.FileChecker
  • public class FileChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods that check whether files have been modified after DexGuard has packaged them.

    This implies that you can not check files that are still modified by other tools after DexGuard. Notably:

    • When creating app bundles, it is not possible to check the files resources.arsc, AndroidManifest.xml, and other xml files, since the Android bundletool still manipulates them when creating the final APK. App bundles are typically used for the Google Play store, to support app slicing, dynamic features, and instant features. The current implementation of the file checker also only supports checking files in the base feature (since other features may not always be available).
    • When creating libraries, it is only possible to check files in the assets directory, since compilers like dx/D8/R8 and resource processors like aapt still convert all other files.
    • When creating APKs with Google Play Signing enabled, it is not possible to check the AndroidManifest.xml file.

    Checking files that are still modified in the build/packaging process would always return a positive result.

    See Also:
    TamperDetector, CertificateChecker

    • Method Detail

      • checkFile

        public int checkFile​(java.lang.String path)
        Determines whether a specified file has been tampered with.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file in the APK file, e.g. "classes.dex" or "assets/keystore.pkcs".
        Returns:
        0 if the file has not been tampered with; a different value otherwise.

      • checkFile

        public int checkFile​(java.lang.String path,
                     int ok)
        Determines whether a specified file has been tampered with.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file in the APK file, e.g. "classes.dex" or "assets/keystore.pkcs".
        ok - an arbitrary integer value, to introduce some diversity in the "OK' return value.
        Returns:
        ok if the file has not been tampered with; a different value otherwise.

      • checkFileInternal

        public FileCheckerReport checkFileInternal​(java.lang.String path,
                                           int ok)
        Determines whether a specified file has been tampered with.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file in the APK file, e.g. "classes.dex" or "assets/keystore.pkcs".
        ok - an arbitrary integer value, to introduce some diversity in the "OK' return value.
        Returns:
        FileCheckerReport containing information collected by the FileChecker.

      • checkListOfFilesInternal

        public FileCheckerReport checkListOfFilesInternal​(java.lang.String[] listOfFiles,
                                                  int ok)
        Determines whether any file in the given list of files has been tampered with.
        Parameters:
        listOfFiles - list of files to check
        ok - an arbitrary integer value, to introduce some diversity in the "OK' return value.
        Returns:
        FileCheckerReport containing information collected by the FileChecker.
